sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}. Compute the Cartesian product of (A ∆ B) × A and B × (A ∆ B), and show that they are not equal, thereby proving that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
